captions.text:
The name German shepherd is a translation
of the Germanic name: Deutsche SchŠferhund.

German shepherds are the second most popular
breed in America.

German shepherds are intelligent and active
dogs, needing lots of exercise and mental

Rin Tin Tin first popularized the breed in
the US circa 1922, starring in 27 Hollywood

German shepherds are known as a "one-man"
breed because of their extreme loyalty to

Capitan, a German shepherd in Argentina, has
stood guard at his owner's grave for the past

Aside from herding, they are working dogs,
taking up a variety of jobs.

A German shepherd named "Buddy" was the first
guide dogs ever!

German shepherds are large dogs and need a
lot of outdoor space

They shed a lot, so brush (and vacuum) almost
daily.

Their bite has 238 lbs of force. A human bite
has 86 lbs.

comments.author: dancer14z

comments.text:
Best dogs ever. I have had 8 shepherds over a 40 year period. They must be 
kept indoors with their family as they are very bonded to their pack. They 
are naturally loyal loving and protective. They get along with other dogs 
and cats if raised with them and socialised often. They love all their 
family members and will protect all of them, but they will always tend to 
one particular family member just a little bit more. They need daily 
exercuse and love to play tug and seek games. If you want a loyal intuitive 
friend who will love you with all their hearts and are prepared to spend 
daily time with them and allow them inside with the family and involve them 
in your lives fully, the the German Shepherd is for you. Invest in a good 
vacum though as they shed ALOT!!!!!!
﻿

comments.text:
I know that GSD's are usually loyal to only 1 person, but my aunt's GSD 
loves everyone. The dog freaks out when I come over too and always comes to 
me even when I don't call her. She'll sit beside me and I'll pet her. She 
won't even move for minutes, just sits there as I pet her. And 1 time my 
aunt put her outside on the back porch, my little brother grabbed my neck 
and tried to "choke" me. Well I gasped and made noises as if I were 
actually hurting. The dog freaked out and started barking and jumping up on 
the window, looking at me. She kept barking until my aunt let her in. And 
she ran right towards me. Idk I found that weird, how panicked she looked. 
And another time I accidentally stepped on her paw and she gave me a look 
of betrayal and actually wouldn't come near me for many frequent visits. 
She loves me once again, but the dog acts like a bloody human sometimes 
lol.﻿

comments.author: Martijn van Zanen

comments.text:
Once a visited a friends family which I do not see that often. It was also 
very late, too late for normal visitors. Their German Shep slept in the 
middle of the room on her carpet between me and the family, which was 
sitting on the couch. I'm very tall and came through the kitchen which is 
quite uncommon. The sleeping dog, not already woken up shot up and bite my 
forearm as a reflex of protective instinct. Then she realized me.

That hurts a lot and gets very blue, a strong protective breed. She felt 
very, very ashamed about her mistake. The most impressive thing was her 
behavior afterwards, how she came over the next day to apologize on her 
own. I will never forget her eyes. She came over and licked my arm and said 
sorry with her body, with her eyes. Call me mad, but I've not had such a 
direct and emotional communication with a human for a long time. I've also 
haven't had seen that much interpersonal skills with a human for years.

But I hate how they breeded the Sheps butt down over the last decades (not 
my friends one, general), these manipulative assholes. That causes so much 
struggle, illness and pain for the dogs. Please, please buy yourself an 
older kind of this breed, with a normal shape, with a healthy straighten 
butt! Don't support perverted animal abusers of breeders and their sick 
fashion. Hip dysplasia is a problem, you'll suffer with the dog, I 
guarantee!﻿

comments.author: Sloth from The Goonies

comments.text:
+micers It doesn't take a sustained attack to kill, especially if it's 
against a small child. Also remember that even small wounds can turn 
septic. 

I think I was wrong to primarily call them nerve biters, although they are 
prone to that trait. They are more prone to biting out of loyalty. If they 
misread a threat to their owner or their litter then they may bite the 
person who they perceive to be a threat. 

I just want to make the point that German Shepherds do have a bit of a 
stigma attached to them, but it is wrong to assume that they are an 
aggressive breed. The reasons for German Shepherd attacks are normally far 
more complex than that.
comments.author: Sloth from The Goonies

comments.text:
+micers That puts it right near the top as far as fatalities are concerned.

Insults are the last resort of an idiot. Grow up and try to let your 
arguments do the talking. Because they're currently falling short.
comments.author: Sloth from The Goonies

comments.text:
+micers German Shepherds are considered to be one of the most dangerous 
breeds, due to their protective nature rather than outright aggression. 
They were once considered to be a dangerous breed in some areas, and so 
were banned. Some states still require them to be on a leash at all times.

The CDC says German Shepherds were involved in 17 dog bite-related 
fatalities from 1979-1988. Although they're intentions are normally noble, 
ie. fighting intruders or protecting puppies.

Do your research before calling other people stupid.
comments.author: Sloth from The Goonies

comments.text:
You have to remember that they bite out of fear rather than aggression. 
They're very nervous, she just though that she was protecting the family 
from an intruder.
comments.author: Sloth from The Goonies

comments.text:
Female of G. Shepherd has height between 56-59 cm at the withers and male 
of G. Shepherd has height between 60-66 cm. It depends on which variant of 
color You want. Original "wolf-grey" colored shepherds are taller (64-66cm 
for males), than "black-yellow" colored. And finally, "wolf-grey" colored 
shepherds have longer life (my shepherd was 14 y.o., when he died) and they 
haven´t so big problems with their hips.

comments.text:
Hey guys I just got my
Gsd Bella. She is exactly 2 months, she does nip and play, how do I get her 
not to nip? I have seen various YouTube videos, but which is the best one?﻿
comments.author: obadiah7771

comments.text:
You don't need to go to obedience training. Treat the pup as you would a 
child. Trust me on this, as they are soo smart and learn quickly. All pups 
will play and nip/mouth you.. especially when patting them. I found the 
best way to "grow" them out of this is to use a stern/firm voice. Say "No" 
and gently hold his muzzle so he/she can't bite/mouth you. They will grow 
out of this in time. On the other side, use rewards such as a tummy scratch 
to reward good behaviour... not food snacks! They like it, and they will 
give you the classic motorbike kick start manoeuvre! ;)  Be careful of over 
enjoyment from your dog on your return home... I mean... Don't let him/her 
jump all over you when you return home from a long period. Yes it is cute, 
but should not be encouraged. Shepherds will do this as they grow out of 
puppy stage. Lastly, expose him/her as much as possible to only your 
closest friends and family. They are fiercely protective to what "they" 
consider their "own" . Do that and you will have a loyal friend for life. 
Good luck!
comments.author: James C

comments.text:
NO, no no no no! Obedience training, shit, it might be too late.. no it's 
not. It's not too late. take her to obedience classes now!!! She will 
continue with the nipping and her bad behavior if you let her! It may be 
costly but you need to in order to take care of a dog. When she does that 
again, talk to her right in the face and say loudly 'NO.' touch your finger 
on her snout and say that, but obedience training!!!!!!

comments.text:
Had German Shepherds all my life the last 2 were as different as 2 dogs 
could be, 1 you could walk in the house do what you want he wouldn't even 
get off the couch. Sadly he was fat dog who stole lots of rease peanut cups 
while we slept when we caught on and put a stop to it he'd tear open a bag 
of potatoes and eat those.he was always sneaking off with something to eat 
and it didn't even have to be food

We did get his weight down enough as a pup for him to live a good 8.5 
 happy years. :-)

The other German Shepherd we thought would kill someone, we had a child 
molester living next door(although we only found out after he moved) he 
made the kids nervous in the neighbourhood very nervous  I'm told he made a 
kid cry once and my dog was out to see it we thought she was going to kill 
him.

From that moment on she tried to go after not just him but any man that got 
too close to a kid we could not afford a fence so when ever she had to go 
do her "business" we would have to be out with her.

Now in the dogs mind she thought she was protecting a kid by try explaining 
that to the cop who showed up and said she had to be put down.

She lived to be 9, .

Would not have another aggressive dog like a German Shepherd without 
knowing how to train them they get too big to handle without some kind of 
training.

I've always loved the breed.﻿
